p.s: The special use of the film-stylistic devices and expeciallyespecially the voiceoverof Starr show the importance of Chris to Starr.

The given excerpt can be divided into three parts: Chris'sChris' walk through the hallways, Starr's and Chris'sChris' conversation about music and sex and the part when Starr pulls Chris to a diffrentdifferent floor.
In the very beginning of the excerpt, Chris is presented in a medium shot with a little zoom.
The effect of this film-stylistic device is that the audience pays attention to the surroundings but also to Chris himself and expeciallyespecially his body language.
He is presented as a very confident and popular student because he is smiling and greeting a lot of other students.
The audience also gets a hint of Starr's view of her boyfriend Chris through the song that is used while he walks up to her.
The song is very romantic: ... can't stop staring at those ocean eyes it says.
This shows Starr's feelings and thoughts while she looks at him.
You can see Starr the first time in this excerpt in a medium close up.
This shot size emphasizes Starr's facial expressions.
She is still a little angry at Chris but she still looks very in love.
The excerpt also shows that Chris knows Starr very well because his Jordans are shown in a close up.
In this sequence the voiceoveris the most important stylistic device in which Starr says that Chris knows her weaknesses.
This shows that Chris knows her very well.
This fact is also shown in the next moment.
Starr is shown in a close up but also in a two shot because the audience can see Chris who is standing behind her.
He is blurred and his head isn't shown on the screen.
The attention is on Starr's facial expressions because this is her first time smiling after their fight.
She smiles because Chris puts headphones with his own music on her ears.
The audience can hear her thoughts through the voice over: It gets me everytime.
This statement shows as already mentioned how close Starr and Chris are.
They like and know almost everything of each other.
The music is also a part of ChrisChris' apologize.
He also irreys his fault and apologizes in words.
His apologize is shown in a close up to show the importance of his words to Starr.
The audience pays attention to his facial expression and in the background the music starts to play again because he removed his headphones so that everybody can hear his music.
Both of them are laughing.
Starr forgives Chris and both of them move on.
Then Chris starts dancing to make Starr more laugh.
He is dancing in a medium long shot with music and a voiceoverin the background.
Starr says that this is how Chris is and that he is making her laugh.
This shows that Chris is in a happy relationship with Starr and that he is also a good boyfriend because he always tries to make her laugh also in difficult situations.
The last sequence is a two shot of both of them.
They are shown in a close up so that the audience can see the happiness on their faces.
Their eyes are sparkling and full of love.
